ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a lot of knowledge about Portuguese and Brazilian culture through the lessons, exercises, and experiential learning activities. I also gained skills in learning linguistic structures and pronunciations.

I learned the basics of Portuguese through an incredibly fun and interactive manner. This class is definitely structured a lot differently than other language classes, but you will still learn the same level of content if not more!
I learned basic conversational Portuguese and gained insight into Brazilian culture. We learned the present and simple past and future tenses.
I gained a basic understanding of common Portuguese phrases and grammar. I feel like I can travel to Brazil and at least ask and opine my way through some basic interactions!
This course enables me to be able to have a conversion in Portuguese and I learnt a lot about Brazils culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is structured very well. The creative and interactive assignments make for an incredibly engaging class experience. The pace of the class is very slow, but not too slow that students would lose focus. I looked forward to class every morning, and that is super important because the class met every weekday. The only weaknesses of the course were too much time spent on Da Minha Janela and not quick enough grading.

I appreciated the course's focus on speaking and learning in a manner that deemphasized tests in favor of cultural competency. The opportunity to work with students in other levels was great, as well the experiential learning opportunities. 

The only weaknesses were that the asynchronous class days typically felt like more work than the regular days, and often took more than 50 minutes to complete the assignments. I also felt that more emphasis on grammar instruction in class would be helpful.

The interactive and realistic learning topics were great. As a spanish speaker, the course was awesome. If I didn't understand Spanish already though, I would have been lost when hearing instructions and assignments. They should be repeated in English.
The focus on involving the students orally instead on simply focusing on grammar etc was great and I believe beneficial to our learning.
This course could have focused more on grammar and reading, but as an introductory course it did just fine.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. If you are trying to decide what language to take, TAKE. PORTUGUESE. Everyone I know in other elementary language classes is struggling and not enjoying their experience. Everyone I know in Portuguese absolutely loves it, adores their professors, and has a very low workload. The exams are super relaxed and reflect the material learned. The assignments are very quick and easy. The projects are super fun and interactive. Once again, I cannot recommend it enough: TAKE PORTUGUESE!
Yes! If you want to learn a language, please consider taking Portuguese! The Portuguese department at Yale is the sweetest and will make sure you actually learn the language and enjoy doing so.

I would definitely recommend this class to anyone interested in leaning Portuguese. The teaching in class always involved participating in class and engaging with our classmates in small groups, giving us the opportunity to express ourselves.
